    Docstrings
    Atom.@!
    Atom.@errs
    Atom.@ierrs — Macro.
    @ierrs(expression)

    Catches errors internal to Atom.jl and renders them in the client.

    Atom.@msg — Macro.
    @msg(expression)

    Calls msg with the name of the top-level function in expression as the first argument and the arguments of that function as the remaining arguments. Note that the toplevel function call will not be evaluated.

    Example: @msg(sin(3)) will call msg("sin", 3), i.e.

    macroexpand(:(Atom.@msg(sin(3)))) == :((Atom.msg)("sin",3))
    Atom.@rpc — Macro.
    @rpc(expression)

    Calls rpc with the name of the top-level function in expression as the first argument and the arguments of that function as the remaining arguments. Note that the toplevel function call will not be evaluated.

    Example: @rpc(sin(3)) will call rpc("sin", 3), i.e.

    macroexpand(:(Atom.@rpc(sin(3)))) == :((Atom.rpc)("sin",3))

    Atom.handle — Function.
    handle(func, typ)

    Set the handler for messages of type typ to func.

    Atom.handlemsg — Function.
    handlemsg(typ, args...)

    Tries to call the message handler corresponding to typ (which can be set with handle).

    Atom.handlers
    Atom.hideprompt
    Atom.highlights
    Atom.id
    Atom.inREPL
    Atom.include
    Atom.info
    Atom.initialise — Function.
    initialise(; welcome = false)

    Sets up the environment for Atom.jl: Stop SIGINTs from killing Julia and send a welcome message to Atom if welcome == true.

    Atom.isactive — Function.
    isactive(sock)

    Check whether the socked sock exists and is open.

    Atom.msg — Function.
    msg(typ, args...)

    Prints a json string to sock that contains all function arguments in an array.

    Atom.returntype
    Atom.rpc — Function.
    rpc(typ, args...)

    Sends a message to sock via msg. Blocks until the client returns a message (which needs to send back the callback field).

    Atom.selector
    Atom.sendnotify
    Atom.serve — Function.
    serve(port; kws...)

    Start an asynchronous Julia server that listens on localhost:port and handle the messages sent over that socket. The kws... are passed through to initialise.

    Atom.showmethod
    Atom.showtrace
    Atom.sock — Constant.
    sock

    Socket over which the communication between server and client happens. Initialized by serve.
